greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2, a(2n) = 3*a(n)-1, a(2n+1) = A254049(a(n)); composition of A048673 and A163511.
comment: Note the indexing: the domain starts from 0, while the range excludes zero.

This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each left hand child is obtained by applying A016789(n-1) when the parent contains n (i.e., multiply by 3, subtract one), and each right hand child is obtained by applying A254049 to the parent's contents:
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: Table[(Times @@ Power[If[# == 1, 1, NextPrime@ #] & /@ First@ #, Last@ #] + 1)/2 &@ Transpose@ FactorInteger@ If[n == 0, 1, Prime[#] Product[Prime[m]^(Map[Ceiling[(Length@ # - 1)/2] &, DeleteCases[Split@ Join[Riffle[IntegerDigits[n, 2], 0], {0}], {k__} /; k == 1]][[-m]]), {m, #}] &[DigitCount[n, 2, 1]]], {n, 0, 63}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 25 2016 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 28 2014
